TopicTitle: [1.9.x] VOID UnVoided - Vessel Orbital Informational Display

Articles.Content: That's true, but it's like linux without good pocketmanager, you may make all crush. also CKAN helps keep mods on date.

2 minutes ago, Argonicus said:

That's true, but it's like linux without good pocketmanager, you may make all crush. also CKAN helps keep mods on date.

True. However after running into a few problems with CKAN I decided to do everything the old fashioned way. Maybe it takes a little bit more time but I hardly have to cope with weird bugs. I know I won't enable CKAN for my own mods ... if they're too technical for the user to install, they aren't for that user anyway.
Creator choice, i know how it's is. Same when i making song, only i decide where to post them

On 09/06/2017 at 9:59 PM, Azimech said:

CKAN is overrated. With 90% of the mods you'd do yourself a favour when you install them manually. It's easy, hardly more work than using CKAN, you're improving your skills and at the same time reducing the risk of problems. CKAN is not without problems.

Overrated? Let's have a race to install RO.

Why would I want to improve my skills at a boring repetitive job that a computer can do for me? Computers are good at boring repetitive jobs. I no more want to improve my skills at it than I want to spend my time un-aring and un-tarring Debian packages on the offchance that dpkg suddenly falls down the back of the sofa - and maybe doing all the stuff in the install scripts for those packages by hand, just in case the shell interpreter is gone? Come to think of it, you'd probably prefer I "improve my skills" by writing my own kernel first.

It's not without problems; the best way forward is to get the metadata right, to do work once so that a mod always installs correctly, rather than demanding each user do the donkey work themselves (which they will inevitably get wrong, producing the usual constant stream of "unzipped it in the wrong place" and suchlike.)

Edited June 11, 2017 by damerell

On 6/9/2017 at 4:54 PM, Argonicus said:

Can't wait till it was updated in CKAN

I'll check on it tomorrow.

VOID is now updated in CKAN.

I had been so busy getting all my mods updated, I had forgotten that VOID was in a beta state until this release, and I had never added the new version to CKAN.

All done now, should be available for 1.3
Tnx, void is best mod for gather info about ship

I love VOID!  Is there a prospect for upgrading it to 1.4?
Eventually
Tested in 1.4.2, including the ToadiciousToolsContinued dependency: Seems to work without any obvious issues. Hopefully just needs a version bump and release.

The calculations are off in the old version for 1.4.

For those who are waiting, I have good news:

  • I've updated the code with the new calculations from KER, need to verify them.
  • The code has been updated for 1.4, including the addition of the ToolbarController and the ClickThroughBlocker
  • The setting for the Blizzy toolbar has been removed and is now controlled by the Toolbar Controller

I hope to release it tomorrow, if all goes well

This mod is still essential to us turboheads after all these years, so a very big THANK YOU for continued support!
